description:
Kaede is a normal school girl who was studying for her exams for school when suddenly she is interrupted by Shinobu, a girl who is a ninja-in-training, attempting to complete her exam. The problem is, in order for her to successfully complete her exam, she must steal one of Kaede's panties!

In Kaede's attempt to stop Shinobu from stealing her panties, an unexpected friendship is forged between the two. Kaede soon becomes engrossed in Shinobu's world, surrounded by partying ninjas and a yellow pac-man like thing by the name of Onsokumaru, who claims to be the master of all ninjas!

[Written by MAL Rewrite]

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.description: Centers around the sport of baseball.

node.description:
__Height:__ 153 cm 

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/NM_NANAPARTY) | [Website](https://www.mizukinana.jp/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/mizukinanaKING) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/nanamizuki_nm7)

She is admired by many of her fellow actors and fans because of the fact that she has a great amount of power and strength in her singing voice, which surprises many fans due to her regularly petite stature. She was also the winner of the "Best Musical Performance" award in the first Seiyuu Awards. She was also part of the quartet Prits alongside Yumiko Kobayashi, Natsuko Kuwatani, and Hisayo Mochizuki (all four voiced characters in the anime _Sister Princess_). Her singing style comes from singing Enka since she was young.

In July 2020, she married someone from the music industry, and they had their first child on March 16, 2021.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Ittasha in Bakuage Sentai Boonboomger
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kryo1)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/外崎春雄)

Affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/970932685693571072)

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cunepero)**

Kojima got started in the industry one day while he was working as a freelancer in various industries and somehow ended up with a job in anime at the age of 23.

His first project was on the show "[Shima Shima Tora no Shimajirou](https://anilist.co/anime/9768/Shima-Shima-Tora-no-Shimajirou/)" under [Studio Kikan](https://anilist.co/studio/256/Studio-Kikan), where he got started of by doing in-between animation. At the time he was very unexperienced with anime production and has [said](https://www.arabnews.jp/article/arts-culture/article_26145/) he likely would have been fired for his lack of knowledge and poor quality work, if not for the in-between animation checker teaching him everything from scratch.

Later down the line after establishing himself more in the anime industry, he would go on to work on "[Gurren Lagann](https://anilist.co/anime/2001/Tengen-Toppa-Gurren-Lagann/)" as a challenge to himself, where he would put forth mecha and effects animation he had no idea how to prior.

Kojima [states](https://www.arabnews.jp/article/arts-culture/article_26145/) he feels a lot of inspiration from manga artists who are able to think about a story, break it up into panels, and express it in pictures. He has thought about drawing a manga himself, even if it's something simple.

Some of his favorite anime are "[Inital D](https://anilist.co/anime/185/Initial-D/)," "[Natsume's Book of Friends](https://anilist.co/anime/4081/Natsume-Yuujinchou/)," "[Re:ZERO -Starting Life in Another World-](https://anilist.co/anime/21355/ReZero-kara-Hajimeru-Isekai-Seikatsu/)," "[Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/Shin-Seiki-Evangelion/)," "[A KITE](https://anilist.co/anime/320/A-KITE/)," "[JIN-ROH](https://anilist.co/anime/570/JINROH/)," "[FLCL](https://anilist.co/anime/227/FLCL/)" and "[Doukyuusei -Classmates-](https://anilist.co/anime/21096/Doukyuusei/)."

Some of his favorite manga are "[HI Score Girl](https://anilist.co/manga/74501/Hi-Score-Girl/)" and "[A White Rose in Bloom](https://anilist.co/manga/108360/Mejirobana-no-Saku/)."
Formerly part of [Ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/). Currently freelance.
__[Website](http://harukichi.main.jp) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/people/Harukichi-Yamamoto/100004428240304/)__
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/金月龍之介)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).
Married to [Takayuki Hirao](https://anilist.co/staff/102247/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hikaruufo) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/近藤光)

Founder and representative director of [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/). Animation producer, sound director and music director for almost every ufotable production. He's also one of the scriptwriters in the studio.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/m_obunai) 

He is a graduate of Yoyogi Animation Gakuin. [Takuya Nonaka](https://anilist.co/staff/107164/Takuya-Nonaka), the current head of Ufotable Tokushima Studio, and animators [Yutaka Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/101801/Yutaka-Nakamura) and [Junichi Fujisaku](https://anilist.co/staff/100423/Junichi-Fujisaku) were His classmates.

Affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/).

__[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/kumanokiyomi/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyokinomaku) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kiyomi.kumano)__

__Birthplace.__ Gifu Prefecture, Japan
__Residency:__ Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan

__Kiyomi Kumano__ is a freelance Japanese vocalist and lyricist.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大野広司)

1977, he joined Kobayashi Production, where he studied under [Shichirou Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/103964/). In 1982, he debuted as an art director on [Tonde Mon Pe](https://anilist.co/anime/6730/), and soon after that he left Kobayashi Production and took part in the founding of Studio Fuga with [Hiromasa Ogura](https://anilist.co/staff/105312/) and [Toshiharu Mizutani](https://anilist.co/staff/121908/). Later became, and is the current representative director of the studio.
Originating from [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/野中卓也)

Originating from Studio Wombat. He has been affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/) since its establishment.

Born in Tokyo and raised in Yokohama, Kanagawa Prefecture, he discovered his passion for anime during middle school, inspired by classics like [Galaxy Express 999](https://anilist.co/anime/1491/Galaxy-Express-999/) and [Lupin III: The Castle of Cagliostro](https://anilist.co/anime/1430/Lupin-The-3rd-The-Castle-of-Cagliostro/). It was in high school that he met a like-minded friend with a love for drawing, sparking his aspiration to become an animator. During those formative years, he actively participated in the art club, where he honed his skills and embarked on creating independent anime projects.

After graduating from the Yoyogi Animation Academy, he joined Studio Wombat as an in-between animator. During his time at the Yoyogi Animation Academy, he shared the same class with notable contemporaries such as [Mitsuru Obunai](https://anilist.co/staff/103077/Mitsuru-Obunai), [Yutaka Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/101801/Yutaka-Nakamura), and [Junichi Fujisaku](https://anilist.co/staff/100423/Junichi-Fujisaku). His journey took a significant turn in 1999 when he played a pivotal role in the establishment of [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/ufotable). Gathering with visionaries like [Hikaru Kondou](https://anilist.co/staff/103076/Hikaru-Kondou) in an old apartment in North Ikebukuro, Tokyo, they laid the foundation for what would become a renowned animation studio. In 2009, he made a significant move to the newly opened ufotable Tokushima Studio, where he assumed a leadership role, overseeing and nurturing a team primarily composed of young talents.

Originally harboring aspirations of becoming a director, he navigated a path from being an animator to realizing his dream. Armed with experiences in key animation and directing, he marked his directorial debut with "Hanaukyo Maid Team: La Verite." Following his move to ufotable Tokushima Studio, he assumed the position of chief of the directing department, leaving his mark on numerous episodes. In his directorial role, he approached each project with careful consideration, assigning cuts to the Tokushima Studio staff thoughtfully, illustrating his dedication and meticulous approach to his craft.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/野中卓也)

Originating from Studio Wombat. He has been affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/) since its establishment.

In 2009, he made a significant move to the newly opened ufotable Tokushima Studio, where he assumed a leadership role, overseeing and nurturing a team primarily composed of young talents.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/193795545)

Originating from [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).
Tomoyasu Kurashima is an animator, animation director, character designer and illustrator.
[Twitter](http://twitter.com/i/user/128364216)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yasu1569) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yasu1569/)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/須藤友徳)

Affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/). Noted for his layouting skills.
